channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ligtlhting at exit of centre to crossing, 11th December
item.description:
If you leave shopping centre heading towards bud dtops/Station the lighting is incredibly bad. Needs brighter or extra light. Felt vulnerable until i got yo the crossing but still not great and I have good eyesight.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Molesworth Street, Ladywell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge trees crushing small trees on pavement, 11th December
item.description:
Private trees overhanging on Sundridge ave crushing small trees on pavements. Reported in October. Report said tree owners had a few weeks to deal with it, but clearly haven't.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Person has set up tent in the vicinity for over a month, 11th December
item.description:
As above this was reported nearly 3 weeks ago and nothing has been done since.. person is still living in the tent in the garage area it's cold windy and rainy so should be concerning . Council land
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Warwick Grove, Hackney, London

item.title: Waste, 11th December
item.description:
The items currently include a dismantled metal frame, wooden pallets and plastic panels placed next to the large purple residential waste container. These materials have been left directly against the building and fencing. This requires urgent removal. Similar dumped items in the area are frequently used by homeless individuals to construct makeshift camps, which has repeatedly created significant health and safety hazards for residents. If the materials are not cleared promptly, it is highly likely the same situation will occur again. Please arrange for these items to be removed as soon as possible to prevent obstruction, anti-social behaviour, and any risk to the residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 159, Bermondsey Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking on corners blocking cars, 10th December
item.description:
This is a reoccurring issue in this area which results in corners being blocked and cars not being able to be moved. The corners here need to be double yellow lines.
